channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Gazan teen musician found new life in playing his oud for children amid war, watch video
item.description: Fifteen-year-old Youssef Saad from Gaza plays his oud for children at a local day centre amid ongoing conflict. Despite losing his home and music school, he remains committed to bringing hope through music. The violence has disrupted many lives, including Saad's family, but he continues to inspire with his dedication.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris-Trump presidential debate key details: Kamala accepts rules to debate Donald, including muted mics
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump will face off in a presidential debate on September 10, amid controversy over microphone rules. Harris accepted ABC News' guidelines to address concerns from Trump's team. Moderated by David Muir and Linsey Davis, the debate will air on ABC and stream online. Harris said on Wednesday that her debate preparations are progressing well, having participated in mock debates with Philippe Reines portraying Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia school shooting: Survivor describes Colt Gray as ‘quiet guy who never really talked,’ recalls chilling moments before he opened fire at Apalachee high
item.description: Lyela Sayarath provides an account of the moments before Colt Gray's shooting at Apalachee High School. Known for his quiet nature and frequent absences, Gray left algebra class only to return with a gun. The incident resulted in the death of 14-year-old Mason Schermerhorn and injuries to nine others before Gray surrendered.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Very demure, very mindful' takes center stage as TikTok creator Jools Lebron tries to trademark viral phrase
item.description: TikTok star Jools Lebron seeks to trademark her viral catchphrase 'very demure, very mindful,' which gained popularity in August. This move aims to cover entertainment and advertising services while supporting her transition as a transgender woman. The trademark filings face competition from others attempting to capitalize on the trend.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: HL: 'Will not leave Gaza border until ...': Netanyahu sets conditions for permanent ceasefire
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that Israel will not vacate the Gaza border corridor until there are guarantees against its use by Hamas for smuggling weapons. He stressed the need for consistent prevention measures. The US is formulating a new ceasefire proposal, but Hamas has rejected all aspects of it so far.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Boeing’s Starliner set to fly solo back to earth — Nasa astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore left behind on ISS
item.description: Nasa's Starliner capsule is scheduled to undock from the ISS, landing in New Mexico after overcoming various issues. The capsule returns without astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams, who stay on the ISS until February. Departure adjustments aim for safety and data collection, reflecting ongoing challenges in Nasa's commercial crew program.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says his debate strategy is to give Harris room to speak
item.description: Donald Trump has announced he will let Kamala Harris speak without interruption during their upcoming presidential debate. This shift comes as the candidates prepare for a crucial face-off hosted by ABC News in Philadelphia. Both campaigns have clashed over microphone rules, with the debate being pivotal for swaying Pennsylvania's swing state voters.

item.title: US elections 2024: Trump and Harris neck-and-neck in key battleground states, new poll shows
item.description: A recent survey indicates a close contest between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris in critical battleground states. Both candidates are tied at 47% support in Pennsylvania, while Harris narrowly leads Trump 48%-47% in Georgia. The poll also shows Harris ahead in Michigan and Wisconsin, with Trump leading in Arizona. The upcoming debate could be decisive.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russian lawmakers denounce US sanctions against Russian state media network
item.description: Russian lawmakers have criticized US sanctions against state media group RT, labeling them as an attack on freedom of speech. The U.S. justice department accused RT employees of attempting to influence the presidential election through a money-laundering scheme. Russian officials deny these allegations and accuse the U.S. of interfering in their domestic matters.

item.title: Tim Walz’s distant cousins rock ‘Nebraska Walz’s for Trump’ shirts, stirring family drama - Here’s what is going down
item.description: A viral photo shows eight individuals in 'Nebraska Walz’s for Trump' T-shirts, who are relatives of Democratic VP nominee Tim Walz. Shared by Charles Herbster and reposted by Trump, the image reveals mixed political views within the family, adding an intriguing layer to Walz's campaign narrative.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: French govt pilots ban on mobile phones at schools
In midst of blackout & chaos, Maduro declares early Xmas in Venezuela
Kamala Harris positions herself as more 'business-friendly' alternative to Biden, proposes $50,000 startup tax deduction: What to know
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has introduced a lower capital gains tax rate than President Biden's proposal, seeking to gain support from Wall Street and Silicon Valley. Her plan includes a substantial new tax break for start-ups and simplified business tax filing, marking her first significant policy divergence from the Biden administration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Apalachee high school shooting: 14-yr- old Colt Gray arrested, 4 dead; Trump calls shooter 'deranged monster' - key details
item.description: A deadly shooting at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, claimed four lives and injured dozens. Authorities responded swiftly to the morning incident, taking one suspect into custody. President Biden called for action against gun violence. The FBI is aiding local efforts as investigations proceed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Liz Cheney? Republican stalwart backing Kamala Harris over Trump in 2024 US presidential election because ...
item.description: Former Rep. Liz Cheney has endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris for the upcoming presidential election due to concerns over Donald Trump and American democracy. Announcing her decision at Duke University, Cheney stressed the importance of safeguarding the Constitution and confirmed she would vote for Harris in November.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Goldman Sachs predicts biggest boost to economy if Harris wins: 'If Trump...'
item.description: Goldman Sachs anticipates that Kamala Harris' win will benefit US economic growth over the next two years, while a Trump victory may hinder it. A Democratic government is expected to create more jobs compared to Republicans. Increased tariffs and stricter immigration policies under Trump could negatively impact GDP growth, it said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Context is crucial': Meta oversight board asks firm to reconsider automatic removal of pro-Palestinian phrase
item.description: Meta Platforms' Oversight Board determined that Facebook should not automatically remove 'From the river to the sea,' a phrase with multiple interpretations. The board stressed context's importance in political speech. Meta appreciated the review, and reactions were divided between support for free speech and concerns about safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China's envoy in New York expelled
item.description: China's envoy in New York was expelled following the arrest of Linda Sun, a former aide to Governor Kathy Hochul, and her husband Chris Hu. They were charged with secretly acting as agents for China. Hochul's office terminated Sun in March 2023 upon discovering misconduct and has cooperated with authorities throughout the investigation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tim Walz's family endorses Trump? Truth behind viral photo
item.description: The photo became viral and believable as Tim Walz's older brother Jeff is opposed to Tim and is a known Republican supporter. 67-year-old Jeff said he is 100% opposed to Tim's ideology. He also said he would be open to publicly endorsing Donald Trump but is in two minds about dragging the family into politics.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Two killed in Georgia school shooting, White House says Biden briefed
item.description: A tragic shooting occurred at Apalachee High School in Barrow County, Georgia, resulting in at least four fatalities and numerous injuries. The school was locked down as police responded heavily to the scene. One suspect is currently in custody. Governor Brian Kemp and the FBI are actively involved in addressing the situation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
